DataElement.preferredName: Additional Chemotherapy Post Recurrent Disease Administered Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the additional administration of chemotherapy after the return of a disease after a period of remission.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Additional Chemotherapy Post Recurrent Disease Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the additional administration of chemotherapy after the return of a disease after a period of remission.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient receive addit
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive additional chemotherapy after recurrence of breast cancer or second primary malignancy of contralateral breast cancer

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received chemotherapy directed at the present recurrence?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient receive additional chemotherapy, bisphosphonates and/or immunotherapy after recurrence of breast cancer or second primary malignancy or contralateral invasive BC

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received any additional cytotoxic chemotherapy for management of recurrent or persistent disease, including re-treatment with inital chemotherapy regimens?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Since the previous report, has the patient received any cancer therapy other than the assigned protocol therapy or commercial Herceptin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had at least one, but no more than 3, prior cytotoxic regimens for management of primary disease?
